key_points: Tiger Woods is still recovering from a severe car accident that happened in February.
His love for his children is reported to be a key motivation in his recovery process.
Woods sustained significant injuries to his right leg due to the car crash.
Investigations revealed Woods was speeding at 87 mph, over 45 mph above the legal limit, before the crash.
Woods was seen without crutches for the first time since the accident at his son Charlie's golf tournament.
Sources claim that Woods is very motivated by his children, Charlie and Sam, to make a full recovery.
He has reportedly made a remarkable recovery recently, feeling stronger and more capable each day.
Physical therapy has been a major component of his recovery, with Woods feeling 'strong and healthy'.
While there's no confirmed return date, Woods allegedly has a timeframe in mind for his comeback.
Woods last competed in the PGA Tour at the Masters in November 2020.
